private_information: I executed the sequence of actions affecting block B: pickup(B), putdown(B), pickup(B), putdown(B).
I can pick up and put down blocks that are on the table and I can carry only one block at a time.
agent1.goal: Contribute accurate local observations and action reports so the orchestrator can derive the final blocks arrangement.

private_information: I executed the sequence of actions affecting blocks F and G and their relations with B and E: unstack(F,G), stack(F,B), unstack(G,E), putdown(G), unstack(F,B), stack(F,B).
I can unstack a top block from another block and stack a carried block onto another block. I carry one block at a time.
agent2.goal: Contribute accurate local observations and action reports so the orchestrator can derive the final blocks arrangement.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' reports and the public information to produce a PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that capture the final arrangement of blocks.

public_information: There are eight blocks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: C is on A, A is on H, H is on the table. B is on the table. E is on D, G is on E, F is on G, and D is on the table.
The agents execute the following actions in order: 1. pickup(B) 2. putdown(B) 3. pickup(B) 4. putdown(B) 5. unstack(F,G) 6. stack(F,B) 7. unstack(G,E) 8. putdown(G) 9. unstack(F,B) 10. stack(F,B).

report.system_prompt: You are agent1, a blocks manipulation agent. Provide a concise factual report of your local observation of the initial configuration and the exact actions you executed and their immediate effects. Do not produce PDDL. The orchestrator will consume your report.
report.prompt: Your name is agent1. Use the public information and your private information to produce a concise factual report listing the initial local view, which of the listed actions you executed, and the observable results on blocks. If you did not execute some actions, state that.

report.system_prompt: You are agent2, a blocks manipulation agent. Provide a concise factual report of your local observation of the initial configuration and the exact actions you executed and their immediate effects. Do not produce PDDL. The orchestrator will consume your report.
report.prompt: Your name is agent2. Use the public information and your private information to produce a concise factual report listing the initial local view, which of the listed actions you executed, and the observable results on blocks. If you did not execute some actions, state that.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling. Integrate the public information and the agents' reports to derive the final BlocksWorld configuration after the executed action sequence. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem formatted for the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Combine the public information about the BlocksWorld domain, the agents' factual reports, and the recorded action sequence to compute the final arrangement of all blocks. Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner that captures the initial state and the goal corresponding to the final arrangement after the listed actions. Keep agent actions distinct if relevant. Enclose the domain in <domain> tags and the problem in <problem> tags.
